intro: Marshallia legrandii, commonly known as the showy marsh marigold, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow petals and dark red centers, which are typical of the Asteraceae family. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along streambanks. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Marshallia legrandii is often found in moist, acidic soils and is adapted to thrive in environments with standing water.
